page.title: 15Transport
page.content: Transport in Ewelme is confined to road transport. There is no railway within the village the nearest station being at Cholsey Henley or Didcot, some 5,10 or 9 miles away respectively. Each station provides fast commuter servics to and are used by several Ewelme residents. The River Thames flows about 3 miles away from Ewelme with all its attendant river traffic but the stream flowing through Ewelme itself is not large enough for boating. Several families in the village do, however, enjoy sailing and boating as a leisure activity. Cars are the most common form of transpot for most villagers, indeed, there are many families with two or more cars. The car has become a virtual necessity to most people as public transpot has become very limited. There are 4 buses a day which go into Wallingford from
